title: How serious is forging high school grades? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s immoral, and it’s unethical. How serious is it? It’s serious enough that there have been multiple cases of students being put in jail - although, those usually involve students hacking into school computers. In this case, reporting is could result in the loss of the counsellors job, and your friend punished by the college. Should you do anything about it? Well, that depends. Is this person a really good friend, who you don’t want to lose, or get in trouble? If so, then, personally, I wouldn’t do anything - obviously, you should do what you feel is best, though. Do what aligns with your morals and values.

His guidance councilor altered his official transcripts? That school employee should be FIRED immediately. He is not doing anyone any favors. The person with poor grades did not deserve to get into that college, another student who did deserve to get in was robbed. Another point, that altering may have given him scholarships\grants he did not deserve and took away that same scholarship\grant from someone who did.

They were collaborating to keep another student who didn’t cheat out of the college, pushing him ahead of that student. If that is true, it should be reported. Gaming the system hurts everyone. It deemphasizes quality and integrity and promotes exploitation.

How would such deception be possible? Most high schools release a student’s transcripts in sealed envelopes which deem them “official” for distribution. Once that seal is broken or tampered with and the documents are removed, the validity of your transcript no matter its contents, become void…
